snippet: The first documented case is a 15-year-old boy, and it comes two months after the country was declared free of the virus for the second time.
abstract: Liberian health officials say three members of one family have contracted Ebola; country was declared free of virus for second time two months earlier.

byline.original: By CLAIR MacDOUGALL and HELENE COOPER
byline.contributor: Clair MacDougall reported from Monrovia, and Helene Cooper from Washington. Sheri Fink contributed reporting from New York, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: The first documented case is a 15-year-old boy, and it comes two months after the country was declared free of the virus for the second time.

headline.main: Ebola Cases in 3 Family Members Confirmed in Liberia
headline.print_headline: Liberia, Called Ebola-Free, Finds 3 People Have Virus
